1 The former treatise have I made, O Theophilus, of all that Giê-su began both to do Và teach, 2 Until the day in which he was taken up, after that he through the Holy Ghost had given commandments unto the apostles whom he had chosen: 3 To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, Và speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom của ĐCT: 4 Và, being assembled together with them, commanded them that they should not depart from Giê-ru-sa-lem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which, saith he, ye have heard of me. 5 For Giăng truly baptized with water; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence. 6 When they therefore were come together, they asked of him, saying, Lord, wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel? 7 Và he said unto them, It is not for you to know the times or the seasons, which the Father hath put in his own power. 8  Nhưng các ngươi sẽ nhận quyền phép

, khi Đức Thánh Linh giáng trên các ngươi: Và các ngươi sẽ là nhân chứng cho Ta cả trong Giê-ru-sa-lem, Và trong cả xứ Giu-đê, Và trong Samaria, Và cho đến tận cùng trái đất. Và when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up; Và a cloud received him out of their sight. Và while they looked stedfastly toward heaven as he went up, kìa, two men stood by them in white apparel; Which also said, Ye men of Ga-li-lê, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? this same Giê-su, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven. Then returned they unto Giê-ru-sa-lem from the mount called Olivet, which is from Giê-ru-sa-lem a ngày Sa-bát's journey. Và when they were come in, they went up into an upper room, where abode both Phi-e-rơ, Và Gia-cơ, Và Giăng, Và An-rê, Philip, Và Thô-ma, Bartholomew, Và Ma-thi-ơ, Gia-cơ the son of Alphaeus, Và Si-môn Zelotes, Và Giu-đa the brother of Gia-cơ. These all continued with one accord in prayer Và supplication, with the women, Và Ma-ri the mother của [Chúa] Giê-su, Và with his brethren. Và in those days Phi-e-rơ stood up in the midst of the disciples, Và said, (the number of names together were about an hundred Và twenty,) Men Và brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of Đa-vít spake before concerning Giu-đa, which was guide to them that took Giê-su. For he was numbered with us, Và had obtained part of this ministry. Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity; Và falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, Và all his bowels gushed out. Và it was known unto all the dwellers at Jerusalem; insomuch as that field is called in their proper tongue, Aceldama, that is to say, The field of blood. For it is written in the book of Psalms, Let his habitation be desolate, Và let no man dwell therein: Và his bishoprick let another take. Wherefore of these men which have companied with us all the time that the Lord Giê-su went in Và out among us,this one is iffy, please validate Beginning from the baptism of John, unto that same day that he was taken up from us, must one be ordained to be a witness with us of his resurrection. Và they appointed two, Giô-sép called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, Và Matthias. Và they prayed, Và said, Thou, Lord, which knowest the hearts of all men, shew whether of these two thou hast chosen, That he may take part of this ministry Và apostleship, from which Giu-đa by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place. Và they gave forth their lots; Và the lot fell upon Matthias; Và he was numbered with the eleven apostles. CHAPTER 2. Và when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.not sure about εν Và suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, Và it filled all nhà where they were sitting. Và there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, Và it sat upon each of them. Và they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, Và began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance. Và there were dwelling at Giê-ru-sa-lem Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven. Now when this was noised abroad, đám đông came together, Và were confounded, because that every man heard them speak in his own language. Và they were all amazed Và marvelled, saying one to another, kìa, are not all these which speak Galilæans? Và how hear we every man in our own tongue, wherein we were born? Parthians, Và Medes, Và Elamites, Và the dwellers in Mesopotamia, Và in xứ Giu-đê, Và Cappadocia, in Pontus, Và Asia, Phrygia, Và Pamphylia, in Egypt, Và in the parts of Libya about Cyrene, Và strangers of Rome, Jews Và proselytes, Cretes Và Arabians, we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works của ĐCT. Và they were all amazed, Và were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this? Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine. But Phi-e-rơ, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, Và said unto them, Ye men of xứ Giu-đê, Và all ye that dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, Và hearken to my words: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it is but the third hour of the day. But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel; Và it shall come to pass in the last days, saith God, I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh: Và your sons Và your daughters shall prophesy, Và your young men shall see visions, Và your old men shall dream dreams: Và on my servants Và on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; Và they shall prophesy: Và I will shew wonders in heaven above, Và signs in the earth beneath; blood, Và fire, Và vapour of smoke: mặt trời shall be turned into darkness, Và the moon into blood, before that great Và notable day của Chúa come: Và it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name của Chúa shall be saved. Ye men of Israel, hear these words; Giê-su of Nazareth, a man approved of God among you by miracles Và wonders Và signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know: Him, being delivered by the determinate counsel Và foreknowledge của ĐCT, ye have taken, Và by wicked hands have crucified Và slain: Whom God hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it. For Đa-vít speaketh concerning him, I foresaw the Lord always before my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved: Therefore did my heart rejoice, Và my tongue was glad; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell, neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption. Thou hast made known to me the ways of life; thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance. Men Và brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch Đa-vít, that he is both dead Và buried, Và his sepulchre is with us unto this day. Therefore being a prophet, Và knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh, he would raise up Christ to sit on his throne; He seeing this before spake of the resurrection của Đấng Christ, that his soul was not left in hell, neither his flesh did see corruption. This Giê-su hath God raised up, whereof we all are witnesses. Therefore being by the right hand của ĐCT exalted, Và having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, he hath shed forth this, which ye now see Và hear. For Đa-vít is not ascended into the heavens: but he saith himself, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, Until I make thy foes thy footstool. Therefore let all nhà of Israel know assuredly, that God hath made that same Giê-su, whom ye have crucified, both Lord Và Christ. Now when they heard this, they were pricked in their heart, Và said unto Phi-e-rơ Và to the rest of the apostles, Men Và brethren, what shall we do? Then Phi-e-rơ said unto them, Repent, Và be baptized every one of you in the name của [Chúa] Giê-su Christ for the remission of tội lỗi, Và ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost. For the promise is unto you, Và to your children, Và to all that are afar off, even as many as the Lord our God shall call. Và with many other words did he testify Và exhort, saying, Save yourselves from this untoward generation. Then they that gladly received his word were baptized: Và the same day there were added unto them about three thousand souls. Và they continued stedfastly in the apostles' doctrine Và fellowship, Và in breaking of bread, Và in prayers. Và fear came upon every soul: Và many wonders Và signs were done by the apostles. Và all that believed were together, Và had all things common; Và sold their possessions Và goods, Và parted them to all men, as every man had need. Và they, continuing daily with one accord in the temple, Và breaking bread from house to house, did eat their meat with gladness Và singleness of heart, Praising God, Và having favour with all the people. Và the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved. CHAPTER 3. Now Phi-e-rơ Và Giăng went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, being the ninth hour.together? Và at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Giê-ru-sa-lem; Và they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of xứ Giu-đê Và Samaria, except the apostles. Và devout men carried Stephen to his burial, Và made great lamentation over him. As for Saul, he made havock của hội thánh, entering into every house, Và haling men Và women committed them to prison. Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word. Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, Và preached Christ unto them. Và the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, hearing Và seeing the miracles which he did. For unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessed with them: Và many taken with palsies, Và that were lame, were healed. Và there was great joy in that city. But there was a certain man, called Si-môn, which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, Và bewitched the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one: To whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power của ĐCT. Và to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries. But when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom của ĐCT, Và the name của [Chúa] Giê-su Christ, they were baptized, both men Và women. Then Si-môn himself believed also: Và when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, Và wondered, kìaing the miracles Và signs which were done. Now when the apostles which were at Giê-ru-sa-lem heard that Samaria had received the word của ĐCT, they sent unto them Phi-e-rơ Và Giăng: Who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost: (For as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name của Chúa Giê-su.) Then laid they their hands on them, Và they received the Holy Ghost. Và when Si-môn saw that through laying on of the apostles' hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money, Saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost. But Phi-e-rơ said unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift của ĐCT may be purchased with money. Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right in the sight of God. Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, Và pray God, if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee. For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, Và in the bond of iniquity. Then answered Si-môn, Và said, Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me. Và they, when they had testified Và preached the word của Chúa, returned to Giê-ru-sa-lem, Và preached phúc-âm in many villages of the Samaritans. Và Saul, yet breathing out threatenings Và slaughter against the disciples của Chúa, went unto the high priest, Và desired of him letters to Damascus to the các nhà hội, that if he found any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto Giê-ru-sa-lem. Và as he journeyed, he came near Damascus: Và suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven: Và he fell to the earth, Và heard a voice saying unto him, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? Và he said, Who art thou, Lord? Và the Lord said, I am Giê-su whom thou persecutest: it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks. Và he trembling Và astonished said, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do? Và the Lord said unto him, Arise, Và go into the city, Và it shall be told thee what thou must do. But the Lord said unto him, Go thy way: for he is a chosen vessel unto me, to bear my name before the Gentiles, Và kings, Và the children of Israel: For I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name's sake. Và Ananias went his way, Và entered into nhà; Và putting his hands on him said, Brother Saul, the Lord, even Giê-su, that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou mightest receive thy sight, Và be filled with the Holy Ghost. Và tức thì there fell from his eyes as it had been scales: Và he received sight forthwith, Và arose, Và was baptized. Và when he had received meat, he was strengthened. Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus. Và tức thì he preached Christ in the các nhà hội, that he is the Son của ĐCT. But all that heard him were amazed, Và said; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Giê-ru-sa-lem, Và came hither for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests? But Saul increased the more in strength, Và confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus, proving that this is very Christ. Và after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him: But their laying await was known of Saul. Và they watched the gates day Và night to kill him. Then the disciples took him by night, Và let him down by the wall in a basket. Và he was with them coming in Và going out at Giê-ru-sa-lem. Và he spake boldly in the name của Chúa Giê-su, Và disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him. Which when the brethren knew, they brought him down to Cæsarea, Và sent him forth to Tarsus. Then had the churches rest throughout all xứ Giu-đê Và Ga-li-lê Và Samaria, Và were edified; Và walking in the fear của Chúa, Và in the comfort of the Holy Ghost, were multiplied. Và xảy đến, as Phi-e-rơ passed throughout all quarters, he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda. Và there he found a certain man named Æneas, which had kept his bed eight years, Và was sick of the palsy. Và Phi-e-rơ said unto him, Æneas, Giê-su Christ maketh thee whole: arise, Và make thy bed. Và he arose tức thì. Và all that dwelt at Lydda Và Saron saw him, Và turned to the Lord. Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas: this woman was full of good works Và almsdeeds which she did. Và xảy đến in those days, that she was sick, Và died: whom when they had washed, they laid her in an upper chamber. Và forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa, Và the disciples had heard that Phi-e-rơ was there, they sent unto him two men, desiring him that he would not delay to come to them. Then Phi-e-rơ arose Và went with them. When he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber: Và all the widows stood by him weeping, Và shewing the coats Và garments which Dorcas made, while she was with them. But Phi-e-rơ put them all forth, Và kneeled down, Và prayed; Và turning him to the body said, Tabitha, arise. Và she opened her eyes: Và when she saw Phi-e-rơ, she sat up. Và he gave her his hand, Và lifted her up, Và when he had called the saints Và widows, presented her alive. Và it was known throughout all Joppa; Và many believed in the Lord. Và xảy đến, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Si-môn a tanner. CHAPTER 10. There was a certain man in Cæsarea called Cornelius, một đội trưởng of the band called the Italian band, A devout man, Và one that feared God with all his house, which gave much alms to the people, Và prayed to God alway. He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel của ĐCT coming in to him, Và saying unto him, Cornelius. Và when he looked on him, he was afraid, Và said, What is it, Lord? Và he said unto him, Thy prayers Và thine alms are come up for a memorial before God. Và now send men to Joppa, Và call for one Si-môn, whose surname is Phi-e-rơ: He lodgeth with one Si-môn a tanner, whose house is by bờ biển: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do. Và when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed, he called two of his household servants, Và a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually; Và when he had declared all these things unto them, he sent them to Joppa. On the morrow, as they went on their journey, Và drew nigh unto the city, Phi-e-rơ went up upon nhàtop to pray about the sixth hour: Và he became very hungry, Và would have eaten: but while they made ready, he fell into a trance, Và saw heaven opened, Và a certain vessel descending unto him, as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners, Và let down to the earth: Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, Và wild beasts, Và creeping things, Và fowls of the air. Và there came a voice to him, Rise, Phi-e-rơ; kill, Và eat. But Phi-e-rơ said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean. Và the voice spake unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common. This was done thrice: Và the vessel was received up again into heaven. Now while Phi-e-rơ doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean, kìa, the men which were sent from Cornelius had made enquiry for Si-môn's house, Và stood before the gate, Và called, Và asked whether Si-môn, which was surnamed Phi-e-rơ, were lodged there. While Phi-e-rơ thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, kìa, three men seek thee. Arise therefore, Và get thee down, Và go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them. Then Phi-e-rơ went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius; Và said, kìa, I am he whom ye seek: what is the cause wherefore ye are come? Và they said, Cornelius the centurion, a just man, Và one that feareth God, Và of good report among all the nation of the Jews, was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house, Và to hear words of thee. Then called he them in, Và lodged them. Và on the morrow Phi-e-rơ went away with them, Và certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him. Và the morrow after they entered into Cæsarea. Và Cornelius waited for them, Và had called together his kinsmen Và near friends. Và as Phi-e-rơ was coming in, Cornelius met him, Và fell down at his feet, Và worshipped him. But Phi-e-rơ took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man. Và as he talked with him, he went in, Và found many that were come together. Và he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company, or come unto one of another nation; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean. Therefore came I unto you without gainsaying, as soon as I was sent for: I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me? Và Cornelius said, Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; Và at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, Và, kìa, a man stood before me in bright clothing, Và said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, Và thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God. Send therefore to Joppa, Và call hither Si-môn, whose surname is Phi-e-rơ; he is lodged in nhà of one Si-môn a tanner by bờ biển: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee. tức thì therefore I sent to thee; Và thou hast well done that thou art come. Now therefore are we all here present before God, to hear all things that are commanded thee of God. Then Phi-e-rơ opened his mouth, Và said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons: But in every nation he that feareth him, Và worketh righteousness, is accepted with him. The word which God sent unto the children of Israel, preaching peace by Giê-su Christ: (he is Lord of all:) That word, I say, ye know, which was published throughout all xứ Giu-đê, Và began from Ga-li-lê, after the baptism which Giăng preached; How God anointed Giê-su of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost Và with power: who went about doing good, Và healing all that were oppressed of the devil; for God was with him. Và we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews, Và in Giê-ru-sa-lem; whom they slew Và hanged on a tree: Him God raised up the third day, Và shewed him openly; Not to all the people, but unto witnesses chosen before of God, even to us, who did eat Và drink with him after he rose from the dead. Và he commanded us to preach unto the people, Và to testify that it is he which was ordained of God to be the Judge of quick Và dead. To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of tội lỗi. While Phi-e-rơ yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word. Và they of the circumcision which believed were astonished, as many as came with Phi-e-rơ, because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost. For they heard them speak with tongues, Và magnify God. Then answered Phi-e-rơ, Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we? Và he commanded them to be baptized in the name của Chúa. Then prayed they him to tarry certain days. CHAPTER 11. Và God, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even as he did unto us; Và put no difference between us Và them, purifying their hearts by faith. Now therefore why tempt ye God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear? But we believe that through the grace của Chúa Giê-su Christ we shall be saved, even as they. Then all đám đông kept silence, Và gave audience to Barnabas Và Phao-lô, declaring what miracles Và wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them. Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to God: But that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, Và from fornication, Và from things strangled, Và from blood. We have sent therefore Giu-đa Và Silas, who shall also tell you the same things by mouth. For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, Và to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things; That ye abstain from meats offered to idols, Và from blood, Và from things strangled, Và from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Và xảy đến, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us, which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying: The same followed Phao-lô Và us, Và cried, saying, These men are the servants of the most high God, which shew unto us the way of salvation. Và this did she many days. But Phao-lô, being grieved, turned Và said to the spirit, I command thee in the name của [Chúa] Giê-su Christ to come out of her. Và he came out the same hour. Và when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone, they caught Phao-lô Và Silas, Và drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers, Và brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city, Và teach customs, which are not lawful for us to receive, neither to observe, being Romans. Và đám đông rose up together against them: Và the magistrates rent off their clothes, Và commanded to beat them. Và when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast them into prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely: Who, having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison, Và made their feet fast in the stocks. Và at midnight Phao-lô Và Silas prayed, Và sang praises unto God: Và the prisoners heard them. Và the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep, Và seeing the prison doors open, he drew out his thanh gươm, Và would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had been fled. Và they said, Believe on the Lord Giê-su Christ, Và thou shalt be saved, Và thy house. Và they spake unto him the word của Chúa, Và to all that were in his house. Và when he had brought them into his house, he set meat before them, Và rejoiced, believing in God with all his house. Now when they had passed through Amphipolis Và Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where was a nhà hội of the Jews: Và Phao-lô, as his manner was, went in unto them, Và three ngày Sa-báts reasoned with them out of the scriptures, Opening Và alleging, that Christ must needs have suffered, Và risen again from the dead; Và that this Giê-su, whom I preach unto you, is Christ. Và when they found them not, they drew Jason Và certain brethren unto the rulers of the city, crying, These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also; Whom Jason hath received: Và these all do contrary to the decrees of Cæsar, saying that there is another king, one Giê-su. Therefore many of them believed; also of honourable women which were Greeks, Và of men, not a few. But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word của ĐCT was preached of Phao-lô at Berea, they came thither also, Và stirred up the people. Và then tức thì the brethren sent away Phao-lô to go as it were to the sea: but Silas Và Ti-mô-thê abode there still. Và they that conducted Phao-lô brought him unto Athens: Và receiving a commandment unto Silas Và Ti-mô-thê for to come to him with all speed, they departed. Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred in him, when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry. Therefore disputed he in the nhà hội with the Jews, Và with the devout persons, Và in the market daily with them that met with him. Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans, Và of the Stoicks, encountered him. Và some said, What will this babbler say? other some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods: because he preached unto them Giê-su, Và the resurrection. Và they took him, Và brought him unto Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, is? For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean. (For all the Athenians Và strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell, or to hear some new thing.) Then Phao-lô stood in the midst of Mars' hill, Và said, Ye men of Athens, I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious. For as I passed by, Và beheld your devotions, I found an altar with this inscription, TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you. God that made the world Và all things therein, seeing that he is Lord of heaven Và earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands; Neither is worshipped with men's hands, as though he needed any thing, seeing he giveth to all life, Và breath, Và all things; Và hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth, Và hath determined the times before appointed, Và the bounds of their habitation; That they should seek the Lord, if haply they might feel after him, Và find him, though he be not far from every one of us: For in him we live, Và move, Và have our being; as certain also of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring. Forasmuch then as we are the offspring của ĐCT, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven by art Và man's device. Và the times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commandeth all men every where to repent: Because he hath appointed a day, in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men, in that he hath raised him from the dead. Và when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked: Và others said, We will hear thee again of this matter. So Phao-lô departed from among them. Howbeit certain men clave unto him, Và believed: among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite, Và một người đờn bà named Damaris, Và others with them. CHAPTER 18. After these things Phao-lô departed from Athens, Và came to Corinth; Và found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla; (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome:) Và came unto them. Và because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, Và wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers. Và he reasoned in the nhà hội every sabbath, Và persuaded the Jews Và the Greeks. Và when Silas Và Ti-mô-thê were come from Macedonia, Phao-lô was pressed in the spirit, Và testified to the Jews that Giê-su was Christ. Và when they opposed themselves, Và blasphemed, he shook his raiment, Và said unto them, Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean: from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles. Và he departed thence, Và entered into a certain man's house, named Justus, one that worshipped God, whose house joined hard to the nhà hội. Và Crispus, the chief ruler of the nhà hội, believed on the Lord with all his house; Và many of the Corinthians hearing believed, Và were baptized. Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision, Be not afraid, but speak, Và hold not thy peace: For I am with thee, Và không ai shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city. Và he continued there a year Và six months, teaching the word của ĐCT among them. Và when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia, the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul, Và brought him to the judgment seat, Saying, This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law. Và xảy đến, that, as I made my journey, Và was come nigh unto Damascus about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me. CHAPTER 23. Và Phao-lô, earnestly kìaing the council, said, Men Và brethren, I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day. Và the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth. For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: but the những người Pha-ri-si confess both. Và there arose a great cry: Và những thầy chép luật that were of the những người Pha-ri-si' part arose, Và strove, saying, We find no evil in this man: but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight against God. Và they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy. Và he wrote a letter after this manner: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting. This man was taken of the Jews, Và should have been killed of them: then came I with an army, Và rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman. Và when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds. Và when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man, I sent tức thì to thee, Và gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him. Farewell. Then the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took Phao-lô, Và brought him by night to Antipatris. On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, Và returned to the castle: Who, when they came to Cæsarea, Và delivered the epistle to the governor, presented Phao-lô also before him. Và when the governor had read the letter, he asked of what province he was. Và when he understood that he was of Cilicia; I will hear thee, said he, when thine accusers are also come. Và he commanded him to be kept in Herod's judgment hall. CHAPTER 24. Và after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders, Và with a certain orator named Tertullus, who informed the governor against Phao-lô. Và when he was called forth, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness, Và that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence, We accept it always, Và in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness. Notwithstanding, that I be not further tedious unto thee, I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words. For we have found this man a pestilent fellow, Và a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world, Và a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple: whom we took, Và would have judged according to our law. But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, Và with great violence took him away out of our hands, Commanding his accusers to come unto thee: by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things, whereof we accuse him. Và the Jews also assented, saying that these things were so. Then Phao-lô, after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak, answered, Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation, I do the more cheerfully answer for myself: Because that thou mayest understand, that there are yet but mười hai days since I went up to Giê-ru-sa-lem for to worship. Và they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man, neither raising up the people, neither in the các nhà hội, nor in the city: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me. But this I confess unto thee, that after the way which they call heresy, so worship I the God of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the law Và in the prophets: Và have hope toward God, which they themselves also allow, that there shall be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just Và unjust. Và herein do I exercise myself, to have always a conscience void of offence toward God, Và toward men. Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation, Và offerings. Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, neither with multitude, nor with tumult.NOTE! Again, a totally scrambled verse! Who ought to have been here before thee, Và object, if they had ought against me. Or else let these same here say, if they have found any evil doing in me, while I stood before the council, Except it be for this one voice, that I cried standing among them, Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day. Và when Felix heard these things, having more perfect knowledge of that way, he deferred them, Và said, When Lysias the chief captain shall come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter. Và he commanded một đội trưởng to keep Phao-lô, Và to let him have liberty, Và that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him. Và after certain days, when Felix came with his wife Drusilla, which was a Jewess, he sent for Phao-lô, Và heard him concerning the faith in Christ. Và as he reasoned of righteousness, temperance, Và judgment to come, Felix trembled, Và answered, Go thy way for this time; when I have a convenient season, I will call for thee. He hoped also that money should have been given him of Phao-lô, that he might loose him: wherefore he sent for him the oftener, Và communed with him. But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix' room: Và Felix, willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left Phao-lô bound. CHAPTER 25. Now when Festus was come into the province, after three days he ascended from Cæsarea to Giê-ru-sa-lem. Then the high priest Và the chief of the Jews informed him against Phao-lô, Và besought him, Và desired favour against him, that he would send for him to Giê-ru-sa-lem, laying wait in the way to kill him. But Festus answered, that Paul should be kept at Cæsarea, Và that he himself would depart shortly thither. While he answered for himself, Neither against the law of the Jews, neither against the temple, nor yet against Cæsar, have I offended any thing at all. Then said Phao-lô, I stand at Cæsar's judgment seat, where I ought to be judged: to the Jews have I done no wrong, as thou very well knowest. For if I be an offender, or have committed any thing worthy of death, I refuse not to die: but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me, không ai may deliver me unto them. I appeal unto Cæsar. Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, Hast thou appealed unto Cæsar? unto Cæsar shalt thou go. Và after certain days king Agrippa Và Bernice came unto Cæsarea to salute Festus. Và when they had been there many days, Festus declared Paul's cause unto the king, saying, There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix: About whom, when I was at Giê-ru-sa-lem, the chief priests Và the elders of the Jews informed me, desiring to have judgment against him. To whom I answered, It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die, before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face, Và have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him. Therefore, when they were come hither, without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat, Và commanded the man to be brought forth. Against whom when the accusers stood up, they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition, Và of one Giê-su, which was dead, whom Phao-lô affirmed to be alive. Và because I doubted of such manner of questions, I asked him whether he would go to Giê-ru-sa-lem, Và there be judged of these matters. But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Cæsar. Then Agrippa said unto Festus, I would also hear the man myself. To morrow, said he, thou shalt hear him. Và on the morrow, when Agrippa was come, Và Bernice, with great pomp, Và was entered into the place of hearing, with the chief captains, Và principal men of the city, at Festus' commandment Phao-lô was brought forth. Và Festus said, King Agrippa, Và all men which are here present with us, ye see this man, about whom all đám đông of the Jews have dealt with me, both at Giê-ru-sa-lem, Và also here, crying that he ought not to live any longer.Extra word here "theoreo" But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, Và that he himself hath appealed to Augustus, I have determined to send him. Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. Wherefore I have brought him forth before you, Và specially before thee, O king Agrippa, that, after examination had, I might have somewhat to write. For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner, Và not withal to signify the crimes laid against him. CHAPTER 26. Then Agrippa said unto Phao-lô, Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Phao-lô stretched forth the hand, Và answered for himself: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews: Especially because I know thee to be expert in all customs Và questions which are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.NOTE! Another scrambled verse. My manner of life from my youth, which was at the first among mine own nation at Giê-ru-sa-lem, know all the Jews; Which knew me from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a người Pha-ri-si. Và now I stand Và am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers: Unto which promise our mười hai tribes, instantly serving God day Và night, hope to come. For which hope's sake, king Agrippa, I am accused of the Jews. Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that God should raise the dead? I Quả thật thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name của [Chúa] Giê-su of Nazareth. Which thing I also did in Giê-ru-sa-lem: Và many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; Và when they were put to death, I gave my voice against them. Và I punished them oft in every nhà hội, Và compelled them to blaspheme; Và being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted them even unto strange cities. Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority Và commission from the chief priests, At midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of mặt trời, shining round about me Và them which journeyed with me. Và when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice speaking unto me, Và saying in the Hebrew tongue, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks. Và I said, Who art thou, Lord? Và he said, I am Giê-su whom thou persecutest. But rise, Và stand upon thy feet: for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose, to make thee a minister Và a witness both of these things which thou hast seen, Và of those things in the which I will appear unto thee; Delivering thee from the people, Và from the Gentiles, unto whom now I send thee, To open their eyes, Và to turn them from darkness to light, Và from the power of Satan unto God, that they may receive forgiveness of tội lỗi, Và inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me. Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision: But shewed first unto them of Damascus, Và at Jerusalem, Và throughout all the coasts of xứ Giu-đê, Và then to the Gentiles, that they should repent Và turn to God, Và do works meet for repentance. For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple, Và went about to kill me. Having therefore obtained help of God, I continue unto this day, witnessing both to small Và great, saying none other things than those which the prophets Và Môi-se did say should come: That Christ should suffer, Và that he should be the first that should rise from the dead, Và should shew light unto the people, Và to the Gentiles. Và as he thus spake for himself, Festus said with a loud voice, Phao-lô, thou art beside thyself; much learning doth make thee mad. But he said, I am not mad, most noble Festus; but speak forth the words of truth Và soberness. For the king knoweth of these things, before whom also I speak freely: for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him; for this thing was not done in a corner. King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest. Then Agrippa said unto Phao-lô, Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian. Và Phao-lô said, I would to God, that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, were both almost, Và altogether such as I am, except these bonds. Và when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, Và the governor, Và Bernice, Và they that sat with them: Và when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds. Then said Agrippa unto Festus, This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed unto Cæsar. CHAPTER 27. Và when it was determined that we should sail into Italy, they delivered Phao-lô Và certain other prisoners unto one named Julius, một đội trưởng of Augustus' band. Và entering into a ship of Adramyttium, we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia; one Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us. Và the next day we touched at Sidon. Và Julius courteously entreated Phao-lô, Và gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself. Và when we had launched from thence, we sailed under Cyprus, because the winds were contrary. Và when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia Và Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia. Và there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy; Và he put us therein. Và when we had sailed slowly many days, Và scarce were come over against Cnidus, the wind not suffering us, we sailed under Crete, over against Salmone; Và, hardly passing it, came unto a place which is called The fair havens; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea.NOTE! Extra word: "kalos" and "limen" Now when much time was spent, Và when sailing was now dangerous, because the fast was now already past, Phao-lô admonished them, Và said unto them, Sirs, I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage, not only of the lading Và ship, but also of our lives. Nevertheless the centurion believed the master Và the owner of the ship, more than those things which were spoken by Phao-lô. Và because the haven was not commodious to winter in, the more part advised to depart thence also, if by any means they might attain to Phenice, Và there to winter; which is an haven of Crete, Và lieth toward the south west Và north west. Và when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, loosing thence, they sailed close by Crete. But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon. Và when the ship was caught, Và could not bear up into the wind, we let her drive. Và running under a certain island which is called Clauda, we had much work to come by the boat: Which when they had taken up, they used helps, undergirding the ship; Và, fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, strake sail, Và so were driven. Và we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the next day they lightened the ship; Và the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship. Và when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared, Và no small tempest lay on us, all hope that we should be saved was then taken away. But after long abstinence Phao-lô stood forth in the midst of them, Và said, Sirs, ye should have hearkened unto me, Và not have loosed from Crete, Và to have gained this harm Và loss. Và now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no loss of any man's life among you, but of the ship.NOTE! Scrambled tags! For there stood by me this night the angel của ĐCT, whose I am, Và whom I serve, Saying, Fear not, Phao-lô; thou must be brought before Cæsar: Và, lo, God hath given thee all them that sail with thee. Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even as it was told me. Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island. But when the mười bốnth night was come, as we were driven up and down in Adria, about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country; Và sounded, Và found it twenty fathoms: Và when they had gone a little further, they sounded again, Và found it fifteen fathoms. Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks, they cast four anchors out of the stern, Và wished for the day. Và as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship, when they had let down the boat into the sea, under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship, Phao-lô said to the centurion Và to the soldiers, Except these abide in the ship, ye cannot be saved. Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat, Và let her fall off. Và while the day was coming on, Phao-lô besought them all to take meat, saying, This day is the mười bốnth day that ye have tarried Và continued fasting, having taken nothing. Wherefore I pray you to take some meat: for this is for your health: for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you. Và when he had thus spoken, he took bread, Và gave thanks to God in presence of them all: Và when he had broken it, he began to eat. Then were they all of good cheer, Và they also took some meat. Và we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls. Và when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, Và cast out the wheat into the sea. Và when it was day, they knew not the land: but they discovered a certain creek with a shore, into the which they were minded, if it were possible, to thrust in the ship. Và when they had taken up the anchors, they committed themselves unto the sea, Và loosed the rudder bands, Và hoised up the mainsail to the wind, Và made toward shore. Và falling into a place where two seas met, they ran the ship aground; Và the forepart stuck fast, Và remained unmoveable, but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves. Và the soldiers' counsel was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim out, Và escape. But the centurion, willing to save Phao-lô, kept them from their purpose; Và commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea, Và get to land: Và the rest, some on boards, Và some on broken pieces of the ship. Và so xảy đến, that they escaped all safe to land. CHAPTER 28. Và when they were escaped, then they knew that the island was called Melita. Và the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness: for they kindled a fire, Và received us every one, because of the present rain, Và because of the cold. Và when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks, Và laid them on the fire, there came a viper out of the heat, Và fastened on his hand. Và when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand, they said among themselves, No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he hath escaped the sea, yet vengeance suffereth not to live. Và he shook off the beast into the fire, Và felt no harm. Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but after they had looked a great while, Và saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds, Và said that he was a god. In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island, whose name was Publius; who received us, Và lodged us three days courteously. Và xảy đến, that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever Và of a bloody flux: to whom Phao-lô entered in, Và prayed, Và laid his hands on him, Và healed him. So when this was done, others also, which had diseases in the island, came, Và were healed: Who also honoured us with many honours; Và when we departed, they laded us with such things as were necessary. Và after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria, which had wintered in the isle, whose sign was Castor and Pollux. Và landing at Syracuse, we tarried there three days. Và from thence we fetched a compass, Và came to Rhegium: Và after one day the south wind blew, Và we came the next day to Puteoli: Where we found brethren, Và were desired to tarry with them seven days: Và so we went toward Rome. Và from thence, when the brethren heard of us, they came to meet us as far as Appii forum, Và The three taverns: whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, Và took courage. Và when we came to Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard: but Phao-lô was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him. Và xảy đến, that after three days Phao-lô called the chief of the Jews together: Và when they were come together, he said unto them, Men Và brethren, though I have committed nothing against the people, or customs of our fathers, yet was I delivered prisoner from Giê-ru-sa-lem into the hands of the Romans. Who, when they had examined me, would have let me go, because there was no cause of death in me. But when the Jews spake against it, I was constrained to appeal unto Cæsar; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of. For this cause therefore have I called for you, to see you, Và to speak with you: because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain. Và they said unto him, We neither received letters out of xứ Giu-đê concerning thee, neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee. But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, we know that every where it is spoken against. Và when they had appointed him a day, there came many to him into his lodging; to whom he expounded Và testified the kingdom của ĐCT, persuading them concerning Giê-su, both out of the law of Môi-se, Và out of the prophets, from morning till evening. Và some believed the things which were spoken, Và some believed not.NOTE! Scrambled tags Và when they agreed not among themselves, they departed, after that Paul had spoken one word, Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers, Saying, Go unto this people, Và say, Hearing ye shall hear, Và shall not understand; Và seeing ye shall see, Và not perceive: For the heart of this people is waxed gross, Và their ears are dull of hearing, Và their eyes have they closed; lest they should see with their eyes, Và hear with their ears, Và understand with their heart, Và should be converted, Và I should heal them. Và when he had said these words, the Jews departed, Và had great reasoning among themselves.
